page.title: 05Football-Stambourne Lions
page.content: A few years ago a group of boys wanted to start a football club so they asked parents Ken and Jean Gooderham if they could start a club. Jean and Ken wanted the boys to have a club so they asked the Parish Council if they could use Stamboune playing field as a pitch. Luckily the council agreed. The Club also wrote to Earls Colne & Halstead Educational Charity.A fortnight later a letter came back with a Â£200 cheque enclosed.So Jean and the boys went to a sports shop and brought the best kits there.After that they had a jumble sale which raised some money for the goal posts.First of all they called themselves Steeple Strikers but after a while they called themselves Stambourne Lions because a lot of Stambourne players joined. Now there are two teams playing in local leagues.
